website_summaries.verdict: The Dell XPS 15 is a premium-feeling 4K laptop that outdoes the MacBook Pro in several categories. Its bezel-free design should be the gold standard going forward.
pros: An eye-catching 15-inch 4K display in a nearly bezel-free frame, plus high-end processor and graphics options, all in a slim, professional-looking body
cons: The better configurations can cost a lot, while the keyboard could be bigger and the touchpad has a floaty feel

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Reviewers repeatedly praised the performance and build quality, so my expectations were pretty high. Wow...I'm just blown away. Until you gets yours hand on this awesome machine, it's all hyperbole. This thing rocks! Once again, Dell proves itself to be the best of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Garten

customer_reviews.title: excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: This laptop has everything I need. I's powerful enough to run virtual machines and the display is such high resolution, that sometimes virtual machine or remote desktop display appear so tiny that it's hard to read. Windows 8 can (mostly) scale applications well, so there is no problem with such high resolution. Ubuntu Linux has also excellent scaling mechanism built in the latest version. The laptop is large enough that it may not fit some laptop compartments, but it's thin and light. It does not have Ethernet port built in, but Dell offers a nice USB Ethernet adapter for it, for about $30. Overall I'm very satisfied with this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Greg W

customer_reviews.title: This is Dell's version of the MBP
customer_reviews.text: I almost bought a MacBook Pro, so happy I decided to go with this really slick laptop. It's basically the same specs as a maxed out MBP, but it has even more: touch screen and better nvidia graphics. I like OSX, but the software I use only runs on Windows, so I feel like this is a great alternative to a MBP, oh and I saved 1000 dollars with this PC compared to a MBP.
customer_reviews.author: DTLA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Excelent laptop for a good price. It is really fast and works from the battery for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Sodin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect laptop
customer_reviews.text: i7 4712HQ, 512 SSD, 91 WH which can provide for almost 10h officing, 3200*1800 touchscreen, and is $700 cheaper than a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Yuxuan L.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect computer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this rating cause the computer I bought satisfies all my work necesities. I like this computer because it has very advanced technology and it will work for me for a very long period of time. I would recommend this product to people who needs a really high performance product to deal with new technological applications.
customer_reviews.author: José Miguel

customer_reviews.title: touchpad works very poorly very expensive for what you actually
customer_reviews.text: touchpad works very poorly very expensive for what you actually get
customer_reviews.author: RSA Reatly Services - Todd Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Coil Whine - No solution from Dell
customer_reviews.text: Buyers Beware. Like other I've had numerous issues with this laptop. Dell sent out a technician twice replaced several parts, and I still have daily Coil Whine. Seems like many others are also plagued with the issue. To look into it yourself before dropping 2k on a laptop simple Google: dell xps 15 9530 coil whine
customer_reviews.author: Annoyed

customer_reviews.title: BSOD on startup, and never wakes from sleep
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this PC for a few days, and it has been a phenomenal disappointment, for the money spent. It rarely successfully wakes from sleep. The keyboard lights up, the screen stays dark, and I've had it sitting for five minutes or more like that - with no sign of anything other than the fan running at full tilt and heat being generated. I'm forced to power down and power back up again. This happens more than half the time when I open the lid and hit the power button to wake it up. In the course of a week, I've also had three BSOD's upon waking and/or startup.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dell a little over 6 months ago.I use it everyday.It is by far the worst computer I have ever owned.It crashes way too much, it shuts down at least once a day, I am constantly having issues with it. my 199.00 HP works better,I am so disappointed in this computer . I do like windows 8 though.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Shaw
